summary: A video analysis of the SimpliSafe home security advertisement showcasing the making of the campaign, featuring a character named Robbert Larson and various production insights.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man with a white beard and glasses, wearing a black t-shirt, is seated in a room with a rustic wooden wall background. The room is filled with various items, including books, a model car, and a black cap hanging on the wall. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or interview, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks directly at the camera. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed, with the man's expressions and movements suggesting he is actively communicating. The text "ADWEEK" is visible in the bottom right corner of the frames, indicating the video may be related to a media or advertising context. The setting and the man's demeanor create an informal yet professional ambiance.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a speaker indicating they knew they would be "limited" going into the production, explaining a "normal production was not going to happen." The speaker maintains a conversational tone. There is a single male speaker.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a man in a black shirt and glasses, sitting in a room with wooden walls and shelves filled with books and tools, speaking directly to the camera. The scene transitions to another man wearing a black balaclava and a blue "SimpliSafe" t-shirt, standing in front of a window with a view of greenery and flowers, also speaking to the camera. Text overlays appear, highlighting features such as "24/7 Pro Monitoring + Police Dispatch" and "Contactless" delivery. The video then shows a close-up of a hand placing a SimpliSafe box on a table, followed by a person installing an HD camera on a white wall. The narrative continues with a hand pointing to a smoke detector on a ceiling, emphasizing its importance. The scene shifts to a man in a gray shirt and glasses, sitting in a room with a brick wall, shelves, and a TV, speaking to the camera. The video concludes with the same man, now wearing earphones, in a different room with a round mirror and a sliding door, continuing to speak to the camera. Throughout the video, the "ADWEEK" logo is visible in the bottom right corner, indicating the source of the content.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker presenting Simplisafe as a convenient home security solution, highlighting its online ordering and self-installation. Following this, another male voice enters, remarking on the creative process and logistical challenges of a prior endeavor. Transitioning to the next segment, hip hop music is introduced with a somewhat rebellious and energetic tone. At the same time, sounds suggestive of footsteps can be heard in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a series of interviews with various individuals, each set in distinct environments. It begins with a man in a workshop, surrounded by tools and automotive memorabilia, speaking directly to the camera. The scene transitions to a split-screen interview with two men, one in a room filled with shoes and the other in the workshop, both engaged in conversation. The video then shifts to a man in a well-lit room with a ceiling fan and a bar cart, followed by another man in a room with a bookshelf and a window, and then a man in a room with a plain background. The interviews continue with a man in a room with a brick wall and a television, and another man in a room with a bookshelf and a window. Throughout the video, the 'ADWEEK' logo is visible in the bottom right corner, indicating the production company. The individuals are seen gesturing and speaking, creating a dynamic and engaging atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features multiple speakers identifying themselves. A male speaker says "My name is Wade Devers," mentioning his role as Creative Director at Electromatic for SimpliSafe. A second male speaker introduces himself as Aaron Lobell, founder and executive producer at Element Productions. Next, a male speaker identifies as Peter Davis, one of the three directors from Callier, and the actor who plays Robert Larson. Following him, another male speaker states "Hi, I'm Hunter Slessenger," also part of Callier. Lastly, a male speaker says "And I'm Eric Leplante" also one third of Callier. The clip ends with several of the male speakers collectively stating "We're all one third."

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a man in a black shirt and white earphones, seated in front of shelves filled with high-heeled shoes, suggesting a stylish or fashion-oriented setting. The scene transitions to a home security expert, Robbert Larson, wearing a 'SimpliSafe' robe and a black ski mask, sitting in a cozy living room with a lamp and a framed family photo, indicating a domestic environment. The narrative then shifts to a man in a blue shirt, standing in a dimly lit room with framed pictures on the wall, creating a mysterious atmosphere. Following this, a man with a white beard and glasses appears in a rustic room with wooden walls, surrounded by books and model cars, adding a personal touch to the setting. The video then shows a split-screen view of two men, one in front of the shoe shelves and the other in the rustic room, suggesting a conversation or interview. The scene changes to a man in a blue shirt in a bright, airy room with large windows and a ceiling fan, indicating a comfortable and well-lit space. The video concludes with the man in the blue shirt continuing to speak, maintaining the same setting and atmosphere, emphasizing a sense of continuity and engagement with the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker preparing to delve into the topic of the Robert Larson character. He asks for an explanation of how long the character has been around. The male speaker proceeds to explain that Robert has been around for almost a year, conceiving against a brief. He then elaborates on the brief, asking to create a transactional brand-building idea, which the brief kind of begged for a spokesperson. He ponders creating a spokesperson that sticks in your brain and builds equity in the brand, as well as builds a bridge from that character to the brand. A second male speaker then appears, discussing Wade coming up with this concept and wanting to make something that resonated from a brand perspective and was able to be leveraged in conversion content that needed to go on social and digital.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a man in a black shirt and white earphones, standing in front of shelves filled with high-heeled shoes, speaking directly to the camera. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, showing the same man on the left and another man with a white beard and glasses on the right, seated in a room with a wooden wall background. The video then cuts to a man in a blue Hawaiian shirt, khaki pants, and a straw hat, standing on the steps of a house with luggage, wearing a black ski mask. The next scene shows a man in a blue shirt and glasses, sitting in a well-lit room with a ceiling fan and a bar cart in the background, speaking to the camera. The video then returns to the man in the black ski mask, now sitting in a bathtub filled with bubbles, with a wooden floor and a white shower curtain in the background. The scene shifts back to the split-screen view, now featuring the man in the black shirt and earphones on the top left, the man with the white beard and glasses on the top right, a man in a black shirt on the bottom left, and a man in a light green shirt on the bottom right, all speaking to the camera. The video concludes with a close-up of the man in the black shirt and earphones, standing in front of the high-heeled shoe shelves, continuing to speak to the camera. Throughout the video, the 'ADWEEK' logo is visible in the bottom right corner of each frame.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker discussing Robert Larson, mentioning, "Was there ever consideration of making him kind of more menacing?" He describes the character as a "friendly personification of of all that might go wrong, or kind of danger and fear." He is followed by a second male speaker who is talking about SimpliSafe and attributes of it being "pleasant to to work with." He mentions that it would be "incongruous to have a an overly menacing spokesperson." The third male speaker chimes in with, "We literally started casting for this character, and Peter, one of the directors, threw his hat in the ring." He continues, "Peter set the bar so high, we literally couldn't find anyone better than Peter for this role." Another male speaker follows up, saying, "Peter's a natural at his performance so that we didn't have to worry about that." He then adds, "There was no concern about performance really from the get-go, he just dove right into it."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a series of interviews with four individuals, each in their own distinct setting, as part of an ADWEEK segment. The first person, wearing a black shirt, is seated in a room with a wall of shoes behind him, suggesting a personal interest or profession related to footwear. The second individual, dressed in a gray shirt, is in a cozy living room with a brick wall, bookshelves, and a television, indicating a comfortable home environment. The third person, also in a black shirt, is in a room with a plain background, focusing the viewer's attention on him. The fourth individual, wearing a light green shirt, is in a room with a bookshelf and a lamp, creating a studious atmosphere. Throughout the video, the ADWEEK logo is visible, signifying the media outlet's involvement. The individuals are engaged in conversation, with the second person gesturing with a pen, and the fourth person gesturing with his hand, adding a dynamic element to the interviews. The video transitions between close-ups of each person, highlighting their expressions and gestures, and providing a glimpse into their unique environments.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker boasting about memorizing all lines without needing to consult the script. This transitions to another male speaker stating that the project started when they realized they would be confined for a while and started discussing possibilities. The first speaker then expresses how they wrote a script and passed it off. Subsequently, they went back and forth on how to execute the project. The speaker adds that their approach was to trust the team. Then another male speaker recalls being told if they had any ideas to elevate the project, to go for it. Another male speaker then adds that they were given the shooting board and asked to make something awesome, which they delivered. The clip ends with amusement.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a split-screen interview featuring two men, one with a beard and glasses in a room with a wooden wall and the other in a room filled with shoes. The scene transitions to a man in a gray shirt and glasses, wearing earphones, in a room with a brick wall, a TV, and a round mirror. The next scene introduces Eric Laplante, identified by on-screen text as the Co-Founder & Cinematographer/Director of Calyer Creative, in a room with a brick wall, shelves, and a TV. The video then shifts to Eran Lobel, Founder, CEO & Executive Producer of Element Productions, in a room with white walls, a ceiling fan, and a paddle on the wall. The final scene features a man in a gray shirt with a 'MipiliSafe' logo, wearing a black balaclava, standing in a room with large windows and flowers, with text overlays reading '24/7 Pro Monitoring' and 'Police Dispatch.' The video concludes with the 'ADWEEK' logo on a black background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating "Luckily," before asking a question about script preparations before a shoot. A second male speaker with a conversational tone responds by noting the advantage of wearing "a lot of hats," and prioritizing COVID safety protocols, mentioning mask-wearing and social distancing as challenging on-set adjustments. A third male speaker describes the project as "atypical" and intending to feel like Zoom or iPhone footage, without being overly polished, suggesting a character's quarantine communication. The second speaker elaborates that committing to shooting on iPhone led to a less art-directed approach compared to a larger crew setup. Finally, the third speaker remarks that this concept was a significant aspect of the project.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker excitedly sharing how great it was for the three of them to be "back together to work on something," describing it as "putting on an old jacket." He adds that they could "just dive right into it." A second male speaker chimes in, sarcastically asking, "what it looks like is just you three walking around with an iPhone?" Throughout this conversation, there's a soft, rhythmic instrumental music playing in the background, creating a relaxed and slightly nostalgic mood.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with two male voices discussing their on-set collaboration process. One voice explains how they value pre-planning and discussion. He mentions that the only gag they hadn't fully worked out was the "toilet paper gag," describing it as fun to improvise. The second voice chimes in, saying "throwing an iPhone in a cabinet" made the scene work. The audio then abruptly transitions to a male voice that sounds like a commercial speaker. This voice takes on an enthusiastic tone as he emphasizes the benefits of a security system, stating, "take it from an expert. Get Simply Safe and protect your home, your family, and anything else you need to keep a close eye on." A "doink" sound effect is heard.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker discussing the importance of the "toilet paper reveal" and the comedic timing involved. He mentions that the team tested different approaches and shot multiple versions of the gag, emphasizing the benefits of being lean and working remotely, which allows for experimentation without slowing anyone down. He adds that the client felt comfortable and watched from their home using video village.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker inquiring about the reception of a particular advertisement. Another male voice responds with enthusiasm, stating that, from their perspective, it is "doing better than almost anything". The speaker continues on, emphasizing that it is great when "great creative executed in a way that's authentic to the brand" yields positive results. He concludes, noting that they "couldn't hope for a better outcome under worse circumstances". This is followed by the sound of a spray can.
